for.
high priest, chief priest.

1.long: from out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards.

1.long: a man, one of the human race.

the, the definite article.
to, towards, with.
the, the definite article.
(a) God, (b) a god, generally.
in order that, so that.

a gift, present.
and, both.
and, even, also, namely.
abstr. and concr: sacrifice; a sacrifice, offering.
gen: in behalf of; acc: above.
prop: missing the mark; hence: (a) guilt, sin, (b) a fault, failure (in an ethical sense), sinful deed.

2.brief: I bear gently with, have compassion
2.long: I bear gently with, have compassion.
(a) I am powerful, have (the) power, (b) I am able, I can.

2.brief: I do not know, am ignorant of
2.long: I do not know, am ignorant of (a person, thing, or fact), sometimes with the idea of willful ignorance.
I lead astray, deceive, cause to wander.
of time: when, after; of cause: since, because; otherwise: else.

2.brief: he, she, it, they, them, same
2.long: he, she, it, they, them, same.
I lie about, surround; I am encompassed, surrounded, or clothed with, am in submission to.
want of strength, weakness, illness, suffering, calamity, frailty.

according to the manner in which, in the degree that, just as, as.

prop: missing the mark; hence: (a) guilt, sin, (b) a fault, failure (in an ethical sense), sinful deed.

4.long: any one, some one, a certain one or thing.
(a) I receive, get, (b) I take, lay hold of.
(a) I call, summon, invite, (b) I call, name.
according to the manner in which, in the degree that, just as, as.

5.long: I glorify, honor, bestow glory on.

5.brief: I come into being, am born
5.long: I come into being, am born, become, come about, happen.
(I talk, chatter in classical Greek, but in NT a more dignified word) I speak, say.

5.brief: he, she, it, they, them, same
5.long: he, she, it, they, them, same.

5.brief: I beget, bring forth, give birth to
5.long: I beget (of the male), (of the female) I bring forth, give birth to.

6.long: according to the manner in which, in the degree that, just as, as.
(a) of two: another, a second, (b) other, different, (c) one's neighbor.
(denoting speech in progress), (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
a priest, one who offers sacrifice to a god (in Jewish and pagan religions; of Christians only met.).
into, in, unto, to, upon, towards, for, among.

6.brief: an age, a cycle of time
6.long: an age, a cycle (of time), especially of the present age as contrasted with the future age, and of one of a series of ages stretching to infinity.

6.brief: down from, against, according to, throughout, during
6.long: gen: against, down from, throughout, by; acc: over against, among, daily, day-by-day, each day, according to, by way of.
order, (a) regular arrangement, (b) appointed succession, (c) position, rank.
Melchizedek, king and priest of Salem.

7.long: a day, the period from sunrise to sunset.
flesh, body, human nature, materiality; kindred.

7.long: he, she, it, they, them, same.
(originally: the olive branch held in the hand of the suppliant), supplication, entreaty.

7.long: he, she, it, they, them, same.

7.long: from out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards.

(a) a shout, cry, clamor, (b) outcry, clamoring against another.
strong (originally and generally of physical strength); mighty, powerful, vehement, sure.
(a) I bring to, (b) characteristically: I offer (of gifts, sacrifices, etc).

8.long: I learn; with adj. or nouns: I learn to be so and so; with acc. of person who is the object of knowledge; aor. sometimes: to ascertain.
I am acted upon in a certain way, either good or bad; I experience ill treatment, suffer.

9.long: (a) as a course, a race, or the like: I complete, finish (b) as of time or prediction: I accomplish, (c) I make perfect; pass: I am perfected.

9.brief: I come into being, am born
9.long: I come into being, am born, become, come about, happen.

9.long: he, she, it, they, them, same.

9.brief: the cause of, the originator of
9.long: the cause, author; the culprit, the accused; the crime.
welfare, prosperity, deliverance, preservation, salvation, safety.
age-long, and therefore: practically eternal, unending; partaking of the character of that which lasts for an age, as contrasted with that which is brief and fleeting.

10.long: I address by name, designate, accost.

difficult to interpret, hard to be understood.

of time: when, after; of cause: since, because; otherwise: else.
blunt, dull, hence spiritually; sluggish, remiss, slack.

11.brief: I come into being, am born
11.long: I come into being, am born, become, come about, happen.
hearing, faculty of hearing, ear; report, rumor.

12.long: (a) gen: through, throughout, by the instrumentality of, (b) acc: through, on account of, by reason of, for the sake of, because of.

12.brief: again, further, on the other hand
12.long: again, back, once more, further, on the other hand.
any one, some one, a certain one or thing.
(a) plur: the heavenly bodies, (b) a rudiment, an element, a rudimentary principle, an elementary rule.
(a) rule (kingly or magisterial), (b) plur: in a quasi-personal sense, almost: rulers, magistrates, (c) beginning.
plur: oracles, divine responses or utterances (it can include the entire Old Testament).

12.brief: I come into being, am born
12.long: I come into being, am born, become, come about, happen.

13.brief: all, the whole, every kind of
13.long: all, the whole, every kind of.
I have a share of, participate in, share, partake of, am a member of.

13.brief: a word, speech, divine utterance, analogy
13.long: a word, speech, divine utterance, analogy.
(usually if not always in a Jewish atmosphere), justice, justness, righteousness, righteousness of which God is the source or author, but practically: a divine righteousness.
unlearned, unenlightened; noun: an infant, child.

14.long: perfect, (a) complete in all its parts, (b) full grown, of full age, (c) specially of the completeness of Christian character.

14.brief: but, on the other hand, and
14.long: a weak adversative particle, generally placed second in its clause; but, on the other hand, and.
(a) gen: through, throughout, by the instrumentality of, (b) acc: through, on account of, by reason of, for the sake of, because of.
condition, state, habit, use, especially: good condition of body or soul.
I train by physical exercise; hence: train, in the widest sense.
distinguishing; hence: deciding, passing sentence on; the act of judgment, discernment.
beautiful, as an outward sign of the inward good, noble, honorable character; good, worthy, honorable, noble, and seen to be so.
bad, evil, in the widest sense.
